properties.ariaLabel: earthenginelayer permalink

children.value: is a composite layer that makes it possible to visualize very large datasets. Instead of fetching the entire dataset, it only loads and renders what's visible in the current viewport.

To use this layer, the data must be sliced into "tiles". Each tile has a pre-defined bounding box and level of detail.
Users have the option to load each tile from a unique URL, defined by a template in the

property.
The layer can also supply a callback

that does custom fetching when a tile is requested.
The loaded tile data is then rendered with the layer(s) returned by
This particular example uses the deck.gl React bindings but the
can of course also be used with the pure JavaSript and scripting APIs:

properties.ariaLabel: properties permalink
data options permalink
code classlanguage textdatacode stringarray optional permalink

children.value: Either a URL template or an array of URL templates from which the tile data should be loaded.
If the value is a string: a URL template. Substrings
, if present, will be replaced with a tile's actual index when it is requested.
If the value is an array: multiple URL templates. Each endpoint must return the same content for the same tile index. This can be used to work around
, allowing browsers to download more resources simultaneously. Requests made are balanced among the endpoints, based on the tile index.

properties.ariaLabel: code classlanguage textgettiledatacode function optional permalink

children.value: is called to retrieve the data of each tile. It receives one argument
(String) - resolved url of the tile if the
(Object) - bounding box of the tile. When used with a geospatial view,
. When used used with a non-geospatial view,
It should return either the tile data or a Promise that resolves to the tile data.
This prop is not required if
points to a supported format (JSON or image by default). Additional formats may be added by registering

properties.ariaLabel: code classlanguage texttilesizecode number optional permalink

children.value: The pixel dimension of the tiles, usually a power of 2.
When using a geospatial view, this prop has no effect.
When using a non-geospatial view, the tile size represents the width and height of each tile in world units at zoom level

properties.ariaLabel: code classlanguage textmaxzoomcode numbernull optional permalink

children.value: Use tiles from this level when over-zoomed.

properties.ariaLabel: code classlanguage textminzoomcode number optional permalink
code classlanguage textmaxcachesizecode number optional permalink

children.value: The maximum number of tiles that can be cached. The tile cache keeps loaded tiles in memory even if they are no longer visible. It reduces the need to re-download the same data over and over again when the user pan/zooms around the map, providing a smoother experience.
times the number of tiles in the current viewport.

properties.ariaLabel: code classlanguage textmaxcachebytesizecode number optional permalink

children.value: The maximum memory used for caching tiles. If this limit is supplied,
must return an object that contains a

properties.ariaLabel: code classlanguage textrefinementstrategycode enum optional permalink

children.value: How the tile layer refines the visibility of tiles. One of the following:

: If a tile in the current viewport is waiting for its data to load, use cached content from the closest zoom level to fill the empty space. This approach minimizes the visual flashing due to missing content.
: Avoid showing overlapping tiles when backfilling with cached content. This is usually favorable when tiles do not have opaque backgrounds.
: Do not display any tile that is not selected.

properties.ariaLabel: render options permalink
code classlanguage textrendersublayerscode function optional permalink

children.value: Renders one or an array of Layer instances with all the
: An unique id for this sublayer

properties.ariaLabel: callbacks permalink
code classlanguage textonviewportloadcode function optional permalink

children.value: is a function that is called when all tiles in the current viewport are loaded. The loaded content (as returned by
) for each visible tile is passed as an array to this callback function.

properties.ariaLabel: code classlanguage textontileloadcode function optional permalink

children.value: called when a tile successfully loads.
(Object) - the tile that has been loaded.

properties.ariaLabel: code classlanguage textontileerrorcode function optional permalink

children.value: called when a tile failed to load.
